art.heading: Mali - Kayes
art.content:
MPI stands for Multidimensional Poverty Index, which is where a range of indicators is used to calculate a summary poverty figure for a given population, in which a larger figure indicates a higher level of poverty as noted by  <link="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Multidimensional_Poverty_Index."<color=orange>Multidimensional Poverty Index</color></link>  

The overall MPI score for Mali is 0.457, but the regional score is 0.485 as noted in the <link="https://www.kaggle.com/ophi/mpi?select=MPI_subnational.csv"<color=orange> sub-national database located on kaggle.</color></link> that was last updated 3 years ago.

The percentage of people listed as poor in this region was found to be 82.8%. Of the surveyed regions it has the 3rd highest Intensity of deprivation in the nation at 58.6

The percentage of people listed as poor in this region was found to be 75.5%. Of the surveyed regions it has the 3rd lowest Intensity of deprivation in the nation at 58.2

lvl1Quiz.question: What is meant when someone is asked to find the mode of a dataset?
answers: The numerical result of the sum of all the numbers divided by the total amount of terms
The most common number within the range provided in the dataset
The vibe of a number
The center point of a range of values provided when the dataset is sorted in either ascending or descending order

lvl1Quiz.question: What is meant when someone is asked to find the mean of a dataset?
answers: The numerical result of the sum of all the numbers divided by the total amount of terms
The most common number within the range provided in the dataset
The most aggressive looking number
The center point of a range of values provided when the dataset is sorted in either ascending or descending order

lvl1Quiz.question: What is meant when someone is asked to find the median of a dataset?
answers: The numerical result of the sum of all the numbers divided by the total amount of terms
The most common number within the range provided in the dataset
The number that is most likely to act as a negotiator in a meeting
The center point of a range of values provided when the dataset is sorted in either ascending or descending order

lvl1Quiz.question: What is meant when someone is asked to find the standard deviation of a dataset?
answers: The numerical result of the sum of all the numbers divided by the total amount of terms
The most common number within the range provided in the dataset
The measure of the spread of the values in a dataset
The center point of a range of values provided when the dataset is sorted in either ascending or descending order

lvl1Quiz.question: In a study done by the Oxford Poverty and Human development Initiative as of 2018 it was discovered that Intensity of deprivation on a subnational scale for Mali included the following data points for each of its regions. {58.6, 58.2, 57.8, 59.8, 65.6, 44.9}. What is the average Intensity of deprivation for Mali based on this information to 2 decimal places.
Describe the type of association shown in the following scatterplot:
answers: Positive linear association
Negative linear association
Positive curvilinear association
Negative curvilinear association

lvl1Dialogue.statement: Hello! I am 'The Professor'! What is your name?
pcResponse: It's Bob. Is 'The Professor' your actual name, or just a title?
npcResponse: Hello Ben! Welcome to the Museum!
Joe who- wait... why are you laughing?
Just Ben? ...Well, my actual name is Hugh Jass. You can see why I use my title instead...

lvl1Dialogue.statement: Are you sure that is your name?
pcResponse: Yes, I am sure that I know what my own name is. Thank you very much!
My name is Joe M. Ama.
npcResponse: My apologies, Always good to double check.
Hey Joe M. Ama! Wait...

lvl1Dialogue.statement: Moving on then. Are you aware that you will be undergoing a statistics quiz and that you must get all the answers right to proceed to the next level?
pcResponse: Right and next you'll say that pigs fly
npcResponse: Very good!
Pigs certanly can not fly, however you will need to pass the quiz to progress to the next floor. You see we here at Lig Museum modeled our stairway doors after sphinxes in mythology

lvl1Dialogue.statement: Regardless, Do you know what the mean of a dataset is?
pcResponse: of course I do, do you?
npcResponse: Well then let me explain, the mean is the numerical result of the sum of all the numbers in a given set divided by the total amount of terms
why yes, the mean is the numerical result of the sum of all the numbers in a given set divided by the total amount of terms

lvl1Dialogue.statement: Now, Do you know what the mode of a dataset is?
pcResponse: Does it matter if your just going to tell me anyway?
npcResponse: The mode is the most common number within the range provided in the dataset
I suppose not, the mode is the most common number within the range provided in the dataset

lvl1Dialogue.statement: ok perhaps you know what the median of a dataset is?
pcResponse: Is there any point in me joking around?
npcResponse: Ok then, well the median is the data value separating the upper half of a data set from the lower half.
oh I enjoy a good joke, please tell me one later on. But on to more pressing matters, the median is the data value separating the upper half of a data set from the lower half.

lvl1Dialogue.statement: finally are you aware of how to obtain the standard deviation of a dataset?
npcResponse: Well then let me explain, the standard deviation is the rhe measure of the spread of the values in a dataset and is found by finding the mean, then for each data point we find the square of the distance between the mean and the data point and add these values, we then divide by the total number of data points and take the square root as the answer

pcResponse: About as well as you understand sarcasm it seems
npcResponse: Well don't worry, you can always talk to me again, before or after the quiz
Ah I have been told by my wife that I am a master at understanding and picking up sarcasm so you should do well. If not don't be afraid to come talk to me again

lvl2Dialogue.statement: Hello! I am 'The Handsome Professor'! What is your name?
pcResponse: It's Ben. Is 'The Professor' your actual name, or just a title?
npcResponse: Hello Ben! Welcome to the Museum!
Joe who- wait... why are you laughing?
Just Ben? ...Well, my actual name is Hugh Jass. You can see why I use my title instead...

lvl3Dialogue.statement: Hello! I am 'The Even More Handsome Professor'! What is your name?
pcResponse: It's Ben. Is 'The Professor' your actual name, or just a title?
npcResponse: Hello Ben! Welcome to the Museum!
Joe who- wait... why are you laughing?
Just Ben? ...Well, my actual name is Hugh Jass. You can see why I use my title instead...
